name: OpenStax Microbiology Textbook - Chapter 25
description: Multiple choice questions from the OpenStax Microbiology textbook, Chapter 25. This chapter covers infections of the circulatory and lymphatic systems.
subject: Microbiology

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which term refers to an inflammation of the blood vessels?
questions.explanation: Vasculitis is the general term for inflammation of blood vessels.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following is located in the interstitial spaces within tissues and releases nutrients, immune factors, and oxygen to those tissues?
questions.explanation: Capillaries are the smallest blood vessels and are the site of exchange of nutrients, waste, and oxygen with tissues.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of these conditions results in the formation of a bubo?
questions.explanation: Lymphadenitis, the inflammation of lymph nodes, can result in the formation of a swollen, painful lymph node called a bubo.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following is where are most microbes filtered out of the fluids that accumulate in the body tissues?
questions.explanation: Lymph nodes act as filters for the lymph, trapping microbes and other debris.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following diseases is caused by a spirochete?
questions.explanation: Relapsing fever is caused by spirochetes of the genus Borrelia.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following diseases is transmitted by body lice?
questions.explanation: Epidemic typhus, caused by Rickettsia prowazekii, is transmitted by the human body louse.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: What disease is most associated with Clostridium perfringens?
questions.explanation: Clostridium perfringens is the primary causative agent of gas gangrene.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which bacterial pathogen causes plague?
questions.explanation: The bacterium Yersinia pestis is the causative agent of plague.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following viruses is most widespread in the human population?
questions.explanation: Epstein-Barr virus (EBV), the cause of infectious mononucleosis, is one of the most common human viruses, with estimates of 90-95% of adults being infected worldwide.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of these viruses is spread through mouse urine or feces?
questions.explanation: Hantavirus is transmitted to humans through the inhalation of aerosolized rodent urine, feces, or saliva.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: A patient at a clinic has tested positive for HIV. Her blood contained 700/µL CD4 T cells and she does not have any apparent illness. Her infection is in which stage?
questions.explanation: Stage 1 of HIV infection is characterized by a CD4 T-cell count of 500 cells/µL or greater and no AIDS-defining conditions.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following diseases is caused by a helminth?
questions.explanation: Schistosomiasis is a disease caused by parasitic flatworms called schistosomes.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of these is the most common form of leishmaniasis?
questions.explanation: Cutaneous leishmaniasis, which causes skin sores, is the most common form of the disease.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following is a causative agent of malaria?
questions.explanation: Malaria is caused by protozoan parasites of the genus Plasmodium, with Plasmodium falciparum being the most virulent species.

questions.subject: Microbiology
questions.topic: Infections of the Circulatory and Lymphatic Systems
questions.question: Which of the following diseases does not involve an arthropod vector?
questions.explanation: Schistosomiasis is transmitted through contact with contaminated freshwater containing the larval forms of the parasite, which are released from infected snails.
